<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_remove:
```c
int32 OS_remove(const char *path)
{
    int32 return_code;
    char  local_path[OS_MAX_LOCAL_PATH_LEN];

    return_code = OS_TranslatePath(path, local_path);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return_code = OS_FileRemove_Impl(local_path);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
char  local_path[OS_MAX_LOCAL_PATH_LEN];
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: local_path is a modifiable array (char local_path[...]) used as an output buffer and will be written by OS_TranslatePath. Rule 8.13 concerns pointer types pointing to const-qualified targets when possible; here the object must be writable so it cannot/should not be const. Also, the declaration is an array (not a pointer type), though it decays to char * when passed; making it const would prevent required modification, so the rule is not violated.
